step_data.thought:
Looking at the current state of the page, I can see that I've expanded the 'Product in Websites' section. In this section, I can see there's a checkbox for 'Main Website' (element ID 2452) which is already checked. This indicates that the product is currently configured to be displayed on the Main Website.

However, for a true multi-store setup, there should be multiple websites to select from. Based on what I can see in the accessibility tree, there's only one website option available (Main Website). This suggests that this Magento installation may not have multiple websites configured yet.

In a multi-store Magento setup, you would typically see multiple website options in this section, allowing you to select which websites the product should be available on.

Since I don't see additional websites listed here, I should inform the user about the current state and what would be needed to fully configure a product for multiple websites.
step_data.action: stop('I notice that only one website (Main Website) is currently available in the "Product in Websites" section. To configure a product for multiple websites in a multi-store setup, you would first need to create additional websites in Magento. This can be done through Stores > Settings > All Stores. Once multiple websites are configured, you would be able to select which websites this product should appear on by checking the corresponding boxes in this section. Currently, the product is configured to display on the Main Website only.')
